summary: Build a Valentine-themed multi-page website with a branching Yes/No flow, including specific message pages and a notes input on the 'No' path.
architectural_notes: Implementation decision: build as a single-page React app that switches between screens/pages via state (no real URL routing).

existing_features.title: Create a Valentine-themed first page that displays the prompt text “I'm willing to wait for you, but would I still win if I wait?” and provides two buttons: “Yes” and “No”.

Implement the Valentine website as a single-page React app that switches between screens using in-app state (no URL routing), starting from the existing first screen with the prompt and “Yes”/“No” buttons.

Implement the “No” branch screen: when the user clicks “No” on the first screen, show a screen with the text “why? you should've said it earlier” and provide a notes input where the user can type any message, plus a clearly labeled action button to submit/save that note locally in the UI.

Implement the “Yes” branch multi-screen sequence: when the user clicks “Yes” on the first screen, show a screen containing the provided apology text and a button labeled “move to another page”; then show the next screen with the provided “uncomfortable” message and a button labeled “next”; then show the final screen with the provided closing message.

Apply a coherent Valentine-themed visual design across all screens (consistent colors, typography, spacing, and button styles) suitable for a romantic note site, without using a blue/purple primary palette.

Add and render custom static Valentine-themed image assets (generated at build time) from frontend/public/assets/generated and incorporate them into the UI (e.g., as a background/hero decoration) without serving them from the backend.

Add animated slide transitions between screens when the user navigates through the Valentine flow (First -> No, First -> Yes Step 1 -> Yes Step 2 -> Yes Final), while keeping the app as a single-page React app that switches screens via in-app state (no URL routing).

Add subtle floating animated 'Yes' and 'No' decorative elements to enhance the Valentine theme without interfering with usability (e.g., floating badges/text near the buttons or as background decorations on the first screen).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a Valentine design website with first-page prompt and Yes/No buttons; 'No' leads to a page asking 'why? you should've said it earlier' with a notes input; 'Yes' leads through a sequence of message pages navigated by buttons ('move to another page', 'next') ending with the final message.
Add UI animations such as slide transitions between screens and floating animated Yes/No elements to enhance the Valentine-themed experience.

projectName: Valentine-themed branching multi-page website (Yes/No flow + notes input)
